techs.name: Fishing
techs.quote: 'Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.' - Lao Tzu

techs.name: The Wheel
techs.quote: 'Put your shoulder to the wheel.' - Aesop

techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'O farmers, pray that your summers be wet and your winters clear.' - Virgil

techs.name: Hunting
techs.quote: 'If you chase two rabbits, you will lose them both.' - Native American saying

techs.name: Mysticism
techs.quote: 'Nature herself has imprinted on the minds of all the idea of God.' - Cicero

techs.name: Mining
techs.quote: 'The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.' - Confucius

techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: 'You can't direct the wind, but you can adjust your sails.' - Unknown

techs.name: Pottery
techs.quote: 'Hath not the potter power over the clay, to make one vessel unto honor and another unto dishonor?' - The Bible, Romans

techs.name: Animal Husbandry
techs.quote: 'Blessed shall be the fruit of thy cattle, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.' - The Bible, Deuteronomy 28:4

techs.name: Archery
techs.quote: 'Do not throw the arrow which will return against you.' - Kurdish proverb

techs.name: Meditation
techs.quote: 'Meditation brings wisdom, lack of wisdom leaves ignorance, know well what leads you forward and what holds you back.' – Buddha

techs.name: Polytheism
techs.quote: 'Not at all similar are the race of the immortal gods and the race of men who walk upon the Earth.' - Homer

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: 'It is from their foes, not their friends, that cities learn the lesson of building high walls.' - Aristophanes

techs.name: Horseback Riding
techs.quote: 'If you speak the truth, have a foot on the stirrup.' - Turkish proverb

techs.name: Priesthood
techs.quote: 'The lord bless you and keep you. The Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you. The Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace.' - The Bible, Numbers

techs.name: Bronze Working
techs.quote: 'It is entirely seemly for a young man killed in battle to lie mangled by the bronze spear. In his death all things appear fair.' - Homer

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: 'True glory consists in doing what deserves to be written, in writing what deserves to be read.' - Pliny the Elder

techs.name: Metal Casting
techs.quote: 'And them that take the sword, shall perish by the sword.' - New Testament, Matthew 26:52

techs.name: Iron Working
techs.quote: 'You should hammer your iron when it is glowing hot.' - Publilius Syrus

techs.name: Mathematics
techs.quote: 'If in other sciences we should arrive at certainty without doubt and truth without error, it behooves us to place the foundation of knowledge in mathematics.' - Roger Bacon

techs.name: Alphabet
techs.quote: 'Words have the power to both destroy and heal. When words are both true and kind, they can change our world.' - Buddha
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Science]

techs.name: Monarchy
techs.quote: 'A multitude of rulers is not a good thing, let there be one ruler, one king.' - Herodotus

techs.name: Compass
techs.quote: 'The wisest men follow their own direction.' - Euripides

techs.name: Literature
techs.quote: 'Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed and some few to be chewed and digested.' - Sir Francis Bacon

techs.name: Calendar
techs.quote: 'For everything there is a season and a time for every purpose under heaven.' - Ecclesiastes

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: 'And on the pedestal these words appear 'My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty and despair!' ' - Percy Bysshe Shelley

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: 'Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it.' - Publilius Syrus

techs.name: Machinery
techs.quote: 'A god from the machine' - Menander

techs.name: Drama
techs.quote: 'All the world's a stage, And all the men and women merely players: They have their exits and their entrances; And one man in his time plays many parts.' - William Shakespeare

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: 'A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.' - Antoine de Saint-Exupery

techs.name: Code of Laws
techs.quote: 'To bring about the rule of righteousness in the land so that the strong shall not harm the weak.' – Hammurabi's Code, Prologue

techs.name: Feudalism
techs.quote: 'I will to my lord be true and faithful and love all which he loves and shun all which he shuns.' – Anglo-Saxon Oath of Fealty

techs.name: Optics
techs.quote: 'One doesn't discover new lands without losing sight of the shore.'– Andre Gide

techs.name: Music
techs.quote: 'If music be the food of love, play on.' – William Shakespeare

techs.name: Philosophy
techs.quote: 'I have gained this by philosophy: that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law.' – Aristotle

techs.name: Civil Service
techs.quote: 'The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding breaucracy.' – Oscar Wilde

techs.name: Theology
techs.quote: 'Two cities have been formed by two loves: the earthly by the love of self, the heavenly by the love of God.'– St. Augustine

techs.name: Divine Right
techs.quote: 'I am the state.' – Louis XIV

techs.name: Paper
techs.quote: 'I cannot live without books.' – Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Guilds
techs.quote: 'People of the same trade seldom meet together even for merriment and diversion but the conversation ends at a conspiracy against the public.'– Adam Smith

techs.name: Nationalism
techs.quote: 'A man does not have himself killed for a half pence a day or for a petty distinction. You must speak to the soul in order to electrify him..'– Napoleon Bonaparte

techs.name: Education
techs.quote: 'There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance.'– Ali Bin Abu-Thalib

techs.name: Banking
techs.quote: 'Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.' – Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Military Tradition
techs.quote: 'Victorious warriors win first and then go to war while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.'– Sun-Tzu

techs.name: Liberalism
techs.quote: 'Any society that would give up a little liberty to gain a little security will deserve neither and lose both.' – Benjamin Franklin

techs.name: Economics
techs.quote: 'Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.'– Albert Einstein

techs.name: Gunpowder
techs.quote: 'You can get more of what you want with a kind word and a gun than you can with just a kind word.' - Al Capone

techs.name: Replaceable Parts
techs.quote: 'The whole is more than the sum of its parts.'– Aristotle

techs.name: Democracy
techs.quote: 'It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried.' – Winston Churchill

techs.name: Astronomy
techs.quote: 'Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another.'– Plato

techs.name: Rifling
techs.quote: 'Political power grows out of the barrel of a gun.' – Mao Zedong

techs.name: Chemistry
techs.quote: 'Chemistry means the difference between poverty and starvation and the abundant life.' – Robert Brent

techs.name: Scientific Method
techs.quote: 'I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.' – Galileo Galilei

techs.name: Steam Power
techs.quote: 'You would make a ship sail against the winds and currents by lighting a bonfire under her deck? I have no time for such nonsense.' – Napoleon on Robert Fulton's steamship

techs.name: Steel
techs.quote: 'Before that steam drill shall beat me down, I’ll die with my hammer in my hand.' – John Henry, The Steel-Driving Man

techs.name: Assembly Line
techs.quote: 'People can have the Model T in any color - so long as it's black.' – Henry Ford

techs.name: Physics
techs.quote: 'To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.' – Isaac Newton

techs.name: Biology
techs.quote: 'It is not the strongest of the species that survive but the one most responsive to change.' – Charles Darwin

techs.name: Railroads
techs.quote: 'I fooled you. I fooled you. I got pig iron. I got pig iron. I got all pig iron.' – Lonnie Donegan, "Rock Island Line"

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: 'For once you have tasted flight, you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return.' – Leonardo da Vinci

techs.name: Artillery
techs.quote: 'Artillery adds dignity to what otherwise would be a vulgar brawl.' – Frederick the Great

techs.name: Fascism
techs.quote: 'The great masses of the people will more easily fall victim to a big lie than to a small one.' – Adolf Hitler ("a German Dictator" in the German version)

techs.name: Electricity
techs.quote: 'We will make electricity so cheap that only the rich will burn candles.' – Thomas Edison

techs.name: Medicine
techs.quote: 'As to diseases, make a habit of two things - to help or at least to do no harm.' – Hippocrates

techs.name: Combustion
techs.quote: 'Everything in life is somewhere else and you get there in a car.' - E. B. White

techs.name: Rocketry
techs.quote: 'The Earth is the cradle of the mind, but one cannot eternally live in a cradle.' – Konstantin E. Tsiolkovsky

techs.name: Industrialism
techs.quote: 'There is one rule for the industrialist and that is: Make the best quality of goods possible at the lowest cost possible, paying the highest wages possible.' – Henry Ford

techs.name: Nuclear Fission
techs.quote: 'If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst at once into the sky. That would be like the splendor of a mighty one. I have become death the shatterer of worlds.' – J. Robert Oppenheimer quoting the Bhagavad Gita

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: 'Then one fine mornin' she puts on a New York Station. You know her life was saved by Rock 'n' Roll.'– The Velvet Underground, "Rock and Roll"

techs.name: Refrigeration
techs.quote: 'Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you what you are.' – Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

techs.name: Satellites
techs.quote: 'Beep...Beep...Beep...Beep...' – Sputnik I

techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: 'I just want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.' – Calder Willingham, The Graduate

techs.name: Computers
techs.quote: 'Never trust a computer you can't throw out the window.' – Steve Wozniak

techs.name: Mass Media
techs.quote: 'The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.' – Oscar Wilde

techs.name: Advanced Flight
techs.quote: 'Oh! I have slipped the surly bonds of Earth, put out my hand and touched the face of God.' – John Gillespie Magee

techs.name: Composites
techs.quote: 'The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.' – Aristotle

techs.name: Lasers
techs.quote: 'Nothing travels faster than the speed of light with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.' – Douglas Adams

techs.name: Superconductors
techs.quote: 'What is happiness? The feeling that power is growing, that resistance is overcome.' – Friedrich Nietzsche

techs.name: Stealth
techs.quote: 'Behind a veil, unseen yet present, I was the forceful soul that moved this mighty body.' – Jean Racine

techs.name: Fiber Optics
techs.quote: 'There is a single light of science and to brighten it anywhere is to brighten it everywhere.' – Isaac Asimov

techs.name: Robotics
techs.quote: 'The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.'– B. F. Skinner

techs.name: Genetics
techs.quote: 'Soon it will be a sin for parents to have a child that carries the heavy burden of genetic disease.' – Bob Edwards

techs.name: Nuclear Fusion
techs.quote: 'Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.' – Arthur C. Clarke

techs.name: Future Tech
techs.quote: 'The future will be better tomorrow.' – Dan Quayle
